description: Lonely (or isolated) primes: least prime of distance n from nearest prime (n = 1 or even).
comments: a(1)=least prime of distance 1 from nearest prime.if n>1 a(n)=least prime of distance 2n-2 from nearest prime.
links: Daniel Lignon, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65
mathematica: NextPrim[n_] := Block[{k = n + 1}, While[ !PrimeQ[k], k++ ]; k]; a = Table[0, {35}]; p = 2; q = 3; k = 1; Do[r = NextPrim[q]; m = Min[r - q, q - p]/2; If[m < 35 && a[[m]] == 0, a[[m]] = q]; p = q; q = r, {n, 1, 235000}]Join[{2},Transpose[Flatten[Table[Select[Partition[Prime[ Range[ 1000000]],3,1], Min[ Differences[#]] == 2n&,1],{n,40}],1]][[2]]](* _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 17 2013 *)
author: _David W. Wilson_
